intro: Espeletia incana f. incana, commonly known as the white-flowered espeletia, is a plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy, pale pink to white capitula. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine areas. Its structure consists of a short, thick stem with tightly packed, leathery leaves. The inflorescence is composed of numerous small, tubular flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn.
